current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend section 403 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to improve and clarify certain disclosure requirements for restaurants, similar retail food establishments, and vending machines.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Common Sense Nutrition Disclosure Act
			 of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

Section
			 403(q)(5)(H) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

header.#text:
Amending certain
			 disclosure requirements for restaurants, similar retail food establishments,
			 and vending machines

the number of calories contained in the standard menu item, as

the number

			 divided before presentation to the consumer

the

the number of calories contained

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following flush text:

quoted-block-continuation-text.#text:
In the case
				of restaurants or similar retail food establishments where the majority of
				orders are placed by customers who are off-premises at the time such order is
				placed, the information required to be disclosed under this subclause may be
				provided by a remote-access menu, such as one available on the Internet,
				instead of an on-premises
				menu.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:403/ss:q/p:5/sp:H/cl:iv

quote.#text: For the purposes of this clause,

text.#text:
For the purposes of
				this
				clause,

by adding at the
			 end the following:

term.#tail:
means that the
				nutrient disclosure is within acceptable allowances for variation in nutrient
				content. Such acceptable allowances shall include allowances for variation in
				serving size, inadvertent human error in formulation of menu items, and
				variations in
				ingredients.

text.#text:
For purposes of this subclause, with respect to a
				nutrient disclosure, the term

that come in different flavors, varieties, or

, for which there is a reasonable basis (as such term is defined in

quote.#text:
A restaurant or similar retail
			 food establishment may determine and disclose such content by using any of

			 components, or labeling of one preset standard build. In addition to such

by adding after the period at the

text.#text:
by adding at the

term.#tail:
means the finished version of a menu item most commonly
				ordered by consumers.
